phrases.text: Ai đem con sáo tình bạn sang sông ư (làm răng) để cho để cho con sáo ư hừ ư
phrases.english: who bring classifier (animals) flute love/feelings friend cross over river (particle) (name: (làm) răng) [?] to/leave for/to to/leave for/to classifier (animals) flute (particle) hừ [?] (particle)

culturalContext.description: Rivers ("sông") hold deep significance in Vietnamese culture - the Red River shaped Northern civilization, the Mekong defines the South. River crossings mark major life transitions. This is from the Lý con sáo tradition - mynah bird - playful, nature imagery. Lý songs use free rhythm and elaborate melodic ornamentation. As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Vietnamese civilization developed around major rivers: Red River (Sông Hồng) in North, Mekong (Cửu Long) in South
River ferries (đò sông) appear frequently in folk songs as settings for chance romantic encounters
Lý songs originated in Red River Delta villages, characterized by free rhythm and high tessitura
Lý singers traditionally used elaborate vocal ornaments (melisma, grace notes) to showcase skill
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout. Onomatopoetic phrases use simple repeated pitches or rhythmic patterns to imitate the described sounds. Lý performances use rubato (flexible tempo) allowing singers to expressively stretch or compress phrase timing.

phrases.text: Để cho để cho con sáo sổ lồng bay
phrases.english: to/leave for/to to/leave for/to classifier (animals) flute ledger/release cage fly

culturalContext.description: This is from the Lý con sáo tradition - mynah bird - playful, nature imagery. Lý songs use free rhythm and elaborate melodic ornamentation.
facts: Lý songs originated in Red River Delta villages, characterized by free rhythm and high tessitura
Lý singers traditionally used elaborate vocal ornaments (melisma, grace notes) to showcase skill
Central Vietnamese music is characterized by harsh weather influence, modal system
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
culturalContext.musicalContext: Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative. Lý performances use rubato (flexible tempo) allowing singers to expressively stretch or compress phrase timing.
